title: Sales Intelligence Analyst
job_description: What You Will DoJohnson Controls embraces customer focus, tenacious problem-solving, data-driven decision making and collaboration. The Sales Intelligence Analyst based in Milwaukee, WI, will contribute to this positive culture! You will design, develop and deploy commercial analytic tools aligned with key business initiatives to drive sales behaviors and actions for the North American Security business. This role will work with region and area leaders to create scalable tools which provide actionable insights, KPIs and trends in order to identify areas of potential risk and opportunity.You will also lead the direction and execution of our market intelligence initiatives, including cross-functional intelligence framework and insights to impact decisions across the commercial teams in the Security business. This role will work with the business domain to build out market share models and seller scorecards which will enable the commercial teams to understand entitlements in within local markets. You will also drive analytics and insights around current install base to identify opportunities more easily within BSNAs current customer base.Johnson Controls embraces customer focus, tenacious problem-solving, data-driven decision making and collaboration, and this role will be a key contributor to this culture.How You Will Do ItPartner with the IT team to increase sales intelligence capabilities Create Power BI dashboards focused on Commercial KPIs which drive action and sales behaviorsConnect to data lake sources to build data models to help support the business needsSupport business and trend analysis through the use of data analysis and modeling to identify and generate key insights which support development of action plans to achieve annual business targets on an as-needed basis Understand strategic priorities and business questions where analytic guidance is needed. Develop project plans to tackle key questions and provide direction and guidance based on data and analysis, enabling the organization to hit current year and long-range strategic goalsPartner with the BI team to help create resourcing models to ensure all local markets are right-sized (overserved vs underserved) Identify and expand on development of self-service analytics capabilities in the organizationWhat you will needRequiredBachelor’s degree in business, mathematics or equivalent3+ years of related data analytics experience 3+ years’ experience with a BI Platform (Power BI)Skilled in SQLHighly analytical strategic mindset with an ability to think broadly, refine questions, and develop actionable intelligenceStrong Power BI skillsPossesses business and strategic acumen with ability to communicate broader business vision to cross-functional and technical teamsData-obsessed and action-oriented, creative, resourceful, ethical, self-motivated, and disciplinedStrong interpersonal skills and proven ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience to influence decision making at the highest levelsExcellent analytic & ETL data skills, including advanced Excel, SQL, etc.Strong knowledge of business performance KPIsChange management leadership. Implementation of new processes / systemsStrong organization-building skills, including talent attraction and establishing connections across the JCI enterprise, domains, and regionsJohnson Controls International plc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a qualified individual with a disability or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Controls Software Test Engineer Lead
job_description: At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.We are currently hiring for a Software Test professional to join our controls software test team in La Crosse, WI. The person who takes this position will be responsible for preparing, conducting, and reporting on the testing of embedded-based software for Trane commercial HVAC products.If You Are Someone WhoLoves to think of creative ways to challenge and test software.Is passionate about helping to create bulletproof commercial HVAC products that run 24/7, 365 days a year.Enjoys solving challenging technical problems.And would like to be part of an organization that:Is strong, established, and committed to making a difference in the world by leveraging the power of their multi-billion dollar revenue stream.Values both individual creative thinking and dedicated teamwork.Demands to be challenged by its employees and supports our team members’ desire to increase their skillset.Thrive At Work And At Home Benefits kick in on DAY ONE for you and your family, including health insurance and holistic wellness programs that include generous incentives – WE DARE TO CARE! Family building benefits include fertility coverage and adoption/surrogacy assistance. 401K match up to 6%, plus an additional 2% core contribution = up to 8% company contribution. Paid time off, including in support of volunteer and parental leave needs. Educational and training opportunities through company programs along with tuition assistance and student debt support. Learn more about our benefits here!Job ResponsibilitiesDirect the efforts of a globally dispersed team of software test engineers.Provide estimates for testing schedules, test resources, and equipment needs.Ensure that detailed test requirements are included in product requirements.Keep project and department managers updated on the project testing status.Analyze functional requirements, to generate a comprehensive set of test cases.Write functional test procedures and automated test scripts that provide comprehensive testing of the product requirements.Execute test procedures and automated test scripts as part of formal product testing.Conduct exploratory testing based on detailed knowledge of the product under test.Perform test reviews for other test engineers.Report product issues within the defect tracking system and manage the resulting defect log through the point of defect fix validation.Collaborate with extended team to build and enhance automated test tools and frameworks.Individual Should Be Able ToMeet short- and long-term deadlines.Effectively meet the needs of internal and external customers.Work regularly and dependably.Function in a team environment.Demonstrate ability to cope with stress and maintain a pleasant and cooperative temperament with internal and external customers.Demonstrate ability to perform mental tasks such as making decisions, learning, thinking rationally and exercising good judgment.Take on other duties as assigned.QualificationsBachelor of Science degree in Engineering Technology, Computer Science, Electrical or Computer Engineering, HVACR Technology, or related discipline, or commensurate experience in software development or software testing is required.2 - 6 years of experience in engineering or related discipline.Should have demonstrated proficiency with MS Office and MS Project.Must understand and adhere to safety measures when working with electrical equipment.Should have demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with others in writing and orally.Course work or experience in the following areas is desired: current test methodologies, quality assurance practices, and object-oriented and component based product development.Experience with automated testing is desired.Programming experience is desired.Knowledge of industrial/embedded controls and building control systems is desired.Knowledge of refrigeration cycle/chillers is desired.Experience testing and configuring embedded controllers is desired.We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs. We are an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status.2402836

title: Expert Game System Engineer - Raven Software
job_description: Job TitleExpert Game System Engineer - Raven SoftwareRequisition IDR023045Job DescriptionYour CoreFounded in 1990, Raven Software is the developer of numerous award-winning games including Hexen, Star Wars Jedi-Knight II: Jedi Outcast, Marvel: Ultimate Alliance and most recently, a major contributor to the blockbuster Call of Duty® franchise.We’re based in Middleton, Wisconsin, a suburb of Madison, annually ranked on numerous lists as one of the top places to live and work. We have a unique vision for our industry. One that has and continues to inspire us. We bring no egos. We focus on what is best for the game. We hire stunning peers. We own our own mistakes. We treat each other with respect.After nearly 30 years, Raven Software is still thriving. We developed a team who cares about one another, our games and our players. As we enter the next exciting chapter of our story, we are growing. Our team is creative, highly inventive, well-led and equipped to face this exciting future. If you want to work with a world-class team, on exciting new projects, then apply today! We look forward to hearing from you.Raven Software is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.ravensoftware.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ravensoftware, @RavenSoftware on Twitter / X, or https://www.linkedin.com/company/raven-software/ on Linkedin.Your MissionAs an Expert Game Systems Engineer you will optimizing, enhancing, and developing new engine systems on top of the foundation of Call of Duty’s AAA technology. This is a great opportunity to be part of a passionate team that defines and shapes the technology of our upcoming Call of Duty titles.You will be developing the engine systems for our shipping products as well as improving the workflows of our development team. You will need to be proficient in writing efficient and clean C/C++ code. Qualified candidates will need to have a background in engine development and the subsystems that support games.ResponsibilitiesPriorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:Design, modify, optimize, and debug gameplay systemsResearch and document ways of improving our gameplay systemsDeploy, evaluate performance, and test software on all supported platformsCommunicate features and development with production, engineering, design, and art teamsParticipate in the performance and code review processContribute to the design and roadmap of industry-leading AAA engine technologyCollaboration and co-development with other engineering teamsReports to the Lead Gameplay Systems EngineerPlayer ProfileMinimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in a Computer Science, Engineering, or Math related fieldExperience developing and optimizing engine and game systemsEffective 3D math and algebra skillsStrong programming skills in C/C++Background with multi-threaded systemsUnderstanding of computer architecture and memory managementSolid debugging skillsShipped at least three titles8+ years of experience working in the game industry or related fieldProven ability to collaborate, coordinate, communicate and support other team membersComprehensive understanding of object-oriented programmingCreative, motivated, focused, passionate, results-orientedDemonstrated ability to write efficient, readable, and reliable codePassion for games and technologyExperience with a scripting language, its run-time execution and virtual machineExtra PointsExperience with compilersDevelopment experience with networked multiplayer gamesExperience with systems in a client-server architectureExperience with memory management and garbage collectionOur WorldActivision Blizzard, Inc., is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristicsRewardsRequirementsWe provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $121,500.00 - $224,880.00 Annual. These values reflect the expected base pay range of new hires across all U.S. locations. Ultimately, your specific range and offer will be based on several factors, including relevant experience, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share this role’s range details for your local geography during the hiring process. title: Radio Frequency Engineer
job_description: Joining Nsight Telservices:Nsight Telservices delivers data, voice, and IT services over the latest technology. We compete against the largest communications companies in the world by providing competitive products and local customer service. In our local exchange territories, Nsight Telservices delivers internet, video and voice services to residences and small businesses. With thousands of miles of fiber optic cable and connections to major metropolitan areas, Nsight Telservices provides resilient and redundant fiber-based data and voice services to some of the largest enterprises in Wisconsin. We pride ourselves in delivering great products on the latest technology with superior local customer service. Our customers are our neighbors.What you'll be doing:The RF Engineer designs wireless system with vendor supplied electronics; selects sites, performs operational changes and spectrum management.Performs site selection/placement, tower height evaluation, antenna selection, output power levels and other details involved with the transmission and reception of cellular telephony.Evaluates spectrum utilization at each site, its ability to support traffic and its impact on the system, coordinates with adjacent systems and respective companies.Monitors and trends current system performance, makes changes to improve performance to meet market objectives of minimal dropped calls and quality audio. Analyze E911 and analyze drive test data.Assist Site Acquisition manager with coordinating and completing processing of all legal permits and processes associated with site design; includes dealing with FAA, FCC, state, city, county and local villages and townships.Other duties as assigned.What we're looking for:Bachelor of Science Electrical Engineering degree or comparable experience required.Valid Driver’s licenseIt would also be helpful, but not required to have…3-5 years RF Engineering design and optimizationTo view our competitive benefits, click here!Nsight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information.
